snippet: Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin’s opponents are men who have spent much of their adult lives losing races to him and his allies, underscoring his grip on power in Russia.
abstract: Russian Prime Min Vladimir V Putin’s opponents in country's presidential elections are weak opposition, men who have spent much of their adult lives losing races to him and his allies, underscoring his grip on power; only new face among his rivals Vladimir V Zhirinovsky, Gennady A Zyuganov and Sergei M Mironov is the billionaire Mikhail D Prokhorov.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin’s opponents are men who have spent much of their adult lives losing races to him and his allies, underscoring his grip on power in Russia.

headline.seo: His Support Ebbing, Putin Gains From Weak Rivals
headline.main: Putin Gains as Foes Offer Little Threat
headline.print_headline: Putin Gains As Foes Offer Little Threat
